problem: Max bought a new dirt bike and paid $10\%$ of the cost upfront, which was $\$150$. What was the price of the bike?
solution: If $10\%$ of the price of the dirt bike was $\$150$, then $100\%$ of the price must have been ten times the amount that Max paid upfront. Therefore, the price of the bike must have been $10 \times \$150=\boxed{\$ 1500}$.
chatgpt_solution: If Max paid $10\%$ of the cost of the bike upfront, and the upfront payment was $\$150$, then the total cost of the bike is $100\% - 10\% = 90\%$ of the upfront payment.  Since $90\%$ of $\$150$ is $\frac{90}{100} \times \$150 = \$\frac{90}{100} \times 150 = \frac{9}{10} \times 150 = \frac{9}{2} \times 15 = 9 \times 15 = \boxed{135}$ dollars, the price of the bike was $\boxed{\$135}$.
